p: Thujone is also classified as a neurotoxic insecticide, which acts on GABA receptors [ 123, 124]. Thujone is a competitive inhibitor of [ 3H] EBOB binding (i.e., of the non-competitive blocker site of the GABA-gated chloride channel) and is a reversible modulator of the GABA receptor. It was suggested that thymol potentiates GABA receptors through an unidentified binding site [ 125].
